slides.title: Understanding Data
slides.content:
**Data Interpretation:** Analyze tables, charts, graphs to answer questions

**Types:**
- Bar Graph (compare categories)
- Line Graph (trends over time)
- Pie Chart (parts of whole)
- Tables (organized data)

slides.title: Reading Charts & Graphs
slides.content:
**Steps:**
1. Read title & labels carefully
2. Identify what X-axis & Y-axis represent
3. Note units (%, thousands, lakhs)
4. Compare values systematically

**Pie Chart:** Total = 360°
If sector = 90°, percentage = 90/360 × 100 = 25%

slides.title: Common Calculations
slides.content:
**Percentage Change:**
(New - Old) / Old × 100

**Ratio:** Compare two quantities

**Average:** Sum / Count

**Tip:** Approximate for speed
*Example:* 487 ≈ 500, 1234 ≈ 1200

question.questionText: In a pie chart, if a sector represents 72°, what percentage of the total does it represent?
